intro: Coreopsis isokoensis, commonly known as the Isoko coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange ray flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
